Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, David Strah, Joyce Hunter, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund2. Updates regarding the National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights3. Discussion of a new biography of Leonard Bernstein that outs him and multiple others in his circle, and the status of closeted celebritiesCOMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser4. Ronald Reagan and George Bush booed after speaking in favor of mandatory AIDS testing, also necessity of having medical professionals discuss the issues, and not politiciansCOMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund5. Andy Humm on Mario Cuomo and Ed Koch "getting tough" on AIDS and the issue of mandatory testing6. Clips from President Reagan and Vice-President George Bush's speeches on mandatory testing, booing of audience, and clips from the June 1st 1987 protest in front of the White House7. News Watch, French researchers discover second, genetically different strain of HIV which also causes AIDS8. "The San Francisco Chronicle" apologizes for omitting the names of surviving homosexual partners in obituaries9. In a national poll, AIDS is found to be the third greatest fear of youths aged 8-17, behind only kidnapping and nuclear war, with 65% saying they are "very concerned" with AIDS, and other statistics10. Liberace's estate sues Riverside County, CA as the coroner's linking the star's death with AIDS damaged his posthumous reputationCOMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine11. Sports ReportCOMMERCIAL: Lesbian and Gay Community Services Center12. Lavender Health, interview with Rona Affoumado, clinic coordinator of the Community Health Project13. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. Naming Names, criticism of The New York Times, Sunday MagazineCOMMERCIAL: Heritage of Pride, 24-hour Dance Marathon2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, interview with David Drake of "Vampire Lesbians of Sodom"COMMERCIAL: The Monster3. Rebroadcast of Episode 6 of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "Jock's Itch"4. Closing credits
